feed.title: Google Cloud: AlloyDB for PostgreSQL
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: AlloyDB for PostgreSQL

entry.content: You can now create an AlloyDB instance with a specific IP address range using the Google Cloud CLI, Terraform, or REST API. You can also override IP address range allocations configured during cluster creation. For more information, see [Create an instance with a specific IP address range](https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/cluster-create#ip-instance). This feature is generally available [GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).
entry.summary: You can now create AlloyDB instances with specific IP address ranges using the Google Cloud CLI, Terraform, or REST API, and override existing IP range allocations.
entry.title: Feature: AlloyDB instance IP address range support

entry.content: You can use the columnar engine to improve the performance of vector similarity searches, specifically K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN) searches, when combined with highly-selective predicate filtering. For more information, see [Accelerate your filtered vector search](https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/ai/perform-vector-search#accelerate-filtered-vector-search). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).
entry.summary: A new feature allows for improved performance of vector similarity searches, specifically K-Nearest Neighbor (KNN) searches, when combined with highly-selective predicate filtering. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Improved Vector Search Performance

entry.content: You can let [AlloyDB automatically create Private Service Connect endpoints](https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/configure-private-service-connect#create_the_endpoint_automatically) for authorized projects when you create Private Service Connect-enabled instances, based on your defined service connection policy. This feature is generally available ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).
entry.summary: AlloyDB now supports automatic creation of Private Service Connect endpoints for authorized projects, simplifying network configuration. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Automatic Private Service Connect Endpoints for AlloyDB

entry.content: You can create AlloyDB clusters with [Private Services Connect](https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/configure-private-service-connect#create_the_endpoint_automatically) through the Google Cloud console.
entry.summary: You can now create AlloyDB clusters using Private Services Connect directly from the Google Cloud console.
entry.title: Feature: AlloyDB Private Services Connect Support

entry.content: You can now [start, stop, and restart your primary and read pool AlloyDB instances](https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/instance-start-stop-restart) using the Google Cloud console and the Google Cloud CLI. This feature is generally available ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).
entry.summary: You can now start, stop, and restart your AlloyDB instances using the Google Cloud console and CLI. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: AlloyDB instance management is now GA

entry.content:
The [AlloyDB Omni Kubernetes](/alloydb/omni/current/docs/deploy-kubernetes) operator version 1.4.1 is generally available (GA) and includes the following bug fixes:
* Fix for overriding replication related parameters. This fix lets you override the `wal_keep_size` value. For more information, see [Work with cross-data-center replication](/alloydb/omni/current/docs/cross-data-center-replication/work-with-cross-data-center-replication). This fix requires database version 15.7.1 or later. * 63-character DBCluster names are supported, which lets you define clearer and more descriptive cluster names. * Various bug fixes are implemented to enhance stability and the user experience.
entry.summary: The AlloyDB Omni Kubernetes operator 1.4.1 is now generally available, featuring support for 63-character DBCluster names and fixes for replication parameters and overall stability.
entry.title: Feature: AlloyDB Omni Kubernetes Operator 1.4.1 Released
